name: Hannah Abbot
description: A Hufflepuff girl in Harry’s year and a prefect in books 5 and 6. She was in the D.A. and her mother was killed in Book 6 by a death eater. Marrys Neville Longbottom and becomes the barwoman of the Three Broomsticks

name: Euan Abercrombie
description: A Gryffindor student who first came to Hogwarts in Harry’s 4th year.

name: Steward Ackerley
description: A Ravenclaw student who was first introduced in Goblet of Fire.

name: Falcon Aesalon
description: From ancient Greece, he was the first ever recorded animagus and could transform into a falcon.

name: Agnes
description: A patient in St. Mungo’s who’s head is covered in fur and barks instead of speaks.

name: Cornelius Agrippa
description: Living from 1486 – 1535 and was on a wizard card saying celebrated wizard imprisoned by Muggles for his writing, because they thought his books were evil”. She is also the only card that Ron does not have in his collection (along with Ptolemy).

name: Archibald Alderton
description: On a wizard card and is famous for blowing up a small town in Hampshire while trying to mix a birthday cake.

name: Alguf the Awful
description: A goblin who is known for trying to sell dungbombs.

name: Alphard
description: Sirius Black’s uncle who left Sirius gold to buy his own place. He, like Sirius, has been removed from the Black family tree (probably for leaving Sirius the gold).

name: Archie
description: An old wizard Harry saw while at the world cup, who said he would rather wear a muggle women’s dress than men’s clothing because he “likes a nice healthy breeze around his privates.”

name: Aragog
description: The creature that was believed to be the monster inside the Chamber of Secrets. Was raised by Hagrid inside the castle and is an acromantula. Lives in the forest with it’s family, and ordered Harry and Ron to be killed in Book 2. He also died in Book 6.

name: Arnold
description: Ginny’s pet Pygmy Puff.

name: Bertram Aubrey
description: A boy that Sirius and James Potter used an illegal hex on that made his head swell to twice it’s normal size.

name: Avery
description: A death eater who stayed out of Azkaban by saying he was acting under the imperius curse. He was apologizing to Voldemort in Book 4, but Voldemort then said “crucio” and he fell in pain.

name: Babayaga
description: A Russian hag that ate children for lunch and breakfast.

name: Malcolm Baddock
description: A boy sorted into Slytherin in Book 4.

name: Ludo Bagman
description: Full name, Ludovic Bagman. Head of the department of magical games and sports in the ministry of magic before fleeing at the end of the 4th book. He was an international quidditch player (beater) for the Wimbourne Wasps. While on the team, they won 3 strait league championships. He was the commenter at the Quidditch World Cup and the Triwizard Tournament. He kept trying to give Harry tips on the Triwizard tournament because he bet that Harry would win. He was also charged as a death eater while still in his quidditch days, but got out of it by saying that the death eater was an old family friend, and he had no idea he was a death eater.

name: Otto Bagman
description: Ludo’s brother who had a problem with an unnatural lawnmower and needed attention from Mr. Weasley.

name: (Ludo and Otto’s father) Bagman
description: Father of Ludo and Otto Bagman, and friend of death eater Augustus Rookwood.

name: Millicent Bagnold
description: Minister of Magic before Cornelius Fudge.

name: Bathilda Bagshot
description: Author of A History of Magic. Was killed by Voldemort and then possessed by Nagini

name: Bandon Banshee
description: A creature that Gilderoy Lockhart banished, but was really banished by a witch with a hair lip.

name: Bane
description: A centaur that gets mad at Firenze (another centaur) for helping Harry Potter. He also tells Hagrid to get out of the forest and take Grawp (his giant 1/2 brother) with him.

name: Heathcote Barbary
description: Plays guitar for the wizading band The Weird Sisters.

name: Barker
description: Created the Twigger 90 with Flyte.

name: Musidora Barkwith
description: A famous wizarding composer of her work which featured an exploding Tuba. Her work is now banned after blowing the roof off a building.

name: Barnabas the Barmy
description: A portrait on the 7th floor of Hogwarts across from the room of requirement.

name: Barny
description: The famous mascot of the Ballycastle bats who was featured in a butterbeer add saying I’m just batty about butterbear.

name: Barrufio
description: A wizard mentioned in Book 1 who mis

name: Ali Bashir
description: A wizard who tried to smuggle in flying carpets in Britain (which is not allowed due to the Registry of Proscribed Charmable Objects), and who Mr. Weasley had to deal with his job at the Ministry of Magic, Misuse of Muggle Artifacts.

name: Basil
description: The keeper of the portkeys at the Quidditch World Cup. He disguises as a muggle by wearing a kilt and a poncho and greets the Weasleys, Harry, and Hermione when they arrive (although the comment was directed to Mr. Weasley).

name: Hetty Bayliss
description: A muggle women who save Ron Weasley flying the Ford Angelina before going invisible.

name: Oswald Beamish
description: Leader in Goblin rights.

name: Beedle the Bard
description: Author of wizarding childrenís fairy tales; “The Fountain of Fair Fortune,” “The Wizard and the Hopping Pot” “Babbitty Rabbitty and her Cackling Stump” and “The Tale of the Three Brothers.”

name: Flavius Belby
description: Survived an attack by a lethifold by using the partonus charm. He was also voted the president of the Goblestones club.

name: Marcus Belby
description: A boy in the Slug Club first introduced in Book 6. His uncle Damocles invented the Wolfsbane Potion.

name: Humphrey Belcher
description: A man who believed the time was right to invent the Cheese Cauldron.

name: Katie Bell
description: A Gryffindor girl 1 year above Harry who plays chaser on the Gryffindor quidditch team. She also had a very bad encounter in her 7th year, when somebody put a curse on a necklace she was to deliver and she touched it, making most of her 7th year spent in St. Mungo’s hospital.

name: Amy Benson
description: A girl in Tom Riddle’s orphanage who went into a cave with Riddle and was never the same again.

name: Billy
description: A boy in Tom Riddle’s orphanage who got into an argument with Tom, and who’s rabbit was dead (probably killed by Tom).

name: Binky
description: Lavender Brown’s baby rabbit who was killed (on Oct. 16) by a fox after Professor Trelawney’s prediction that the thing she dreads will come on October 16th.

name: Binns
description: A ghost teacher who teaches History of Magic. It is said that he just died during the night and got up from his chair, not noticing he was dead. He told the students in Harry’s year (in Book 2) about the legend of the Chamber of Secrets.

name: Dennis Bishop
description: A boy in Tom Riddle’s orphanage who went into a cave with Riddle and was never the same again.

name: (Black) Araminta Meliflua
description: Sirius’s mother’s cousin who tried to make muggle hunting legal.

name: (Black) Bellatrix Lestrange
description: (Maiden name Black) Sirius Black’s first cousin who became a death eater and killed Sirius Black. Is believed to be Voldemort’s number 1 death eater.

name: (Black) Aunt Elladora
description: Started the tradition of beheading a house elf when it is too old to hold a tea tray in the Black family.

name: (Black) Narcissa
description: The mother of Draco Malfoy, and the wife of Lucius Malfoy. First cousin of Sirius Black, and sister of Andromeda Tonks and Bellatrix Lestrange.

name: Regulus Black
description: Younger brother of Sirius black who turned into a death eater and was a Slytherin. According to Sirius, he got asked to do something, got scared and tried to back out so Voldemort had him killed.

name: (Black) Uncle Alfred
description: Sirius Black’s uncle who left Sirius gold to buy his own place. He, like Sirius, has been removed from the Black family tree (probably for leaving Sirius the gold).

name: Balfour Blane
description: The wizard who created the Committee on Experimental Charms.

name: Miles Bletchley
description: Keeper for the Slytherin Team. He also hit Angelina in the back with a jinx before a quidditch game.

name: Bloody Barron
description: The Slytherin House Ghost. Fell in love with The Gray Lady (Ravenclaw’s daughter) but she did not love him back, he ended up murdering her and then killed himself as well.

name: Blott. s
description: One of the owners of Flourish and Blotts (Though not confirmed)

name: Beatrix Bloxam
description: Author of children’s books that cause nausea and vomiting; The Toadstool Tales.

name: Blodwyn Bludd
description: A vampire who is known as the Vampire from the Valleys. Sings to its victims before biting their necks.

name: Stubby Boardman
description: Lead singer of the wizarding band the Hobblegoblins. In the magazine The Quibber, it said that this man is Sirius Black, and that he is innocent.

name: Bob
description: The man Mr. Weasley and Harry meet in the elevator on the way to Harry’s hearing in the ministry of magic. He had a chicken with him that breathed fire.

name: Broderick Bode
description: An unspeakable in the Ministry of Magic who works for the Department of Mysteries. He was found dead at 49 in St. Mungo’s strangled by a deadly plant; Devil’s Snare. He was bewitched by Lucius Malfoy to remove the weapon.

name: Bole
description: The Slytherin beater who hit Alicia over the head with the club; claiming that he thought she was the bludger.

name: Pierre Bonnacord
description: First Supreme Mugwump of the International Confederation of Wizards, which the position is now held by Dumbledore. Wanted to ban troll hunting, but was unable to because they were causing trouble in Lichtenstein.

name: Amelia Bones
description: Prior head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement and watched over Harry’s hearing in Book 5. She is fair and honest, but was killed by death eaters in the 2nd year of Voldemort’s return. Aunt of Hufflepuff (in Harry’s year) Susan Bones.

name: Edgar Bones
description: Brother of Amelia Bones and in the Order of the Phoenix, he was killed with his wife and kids by death eaters before the fall of Lord Voldemort. The wizard who killed them escaped in the 5th Book.

name: (Grandmother of Susan Bones) Bones
description: Susan Bones’s grandmother who was killed by death eaters

name: Susan Bones
description: A Hufflepuff girl in Harry’s grade who was in the D.A. who’s aunt, grandmother, and uncle were killed by death eaters. Helped with the ambush of Malfoy on the Hogwarts express in Book 5.

name: Mungo Bonham
description: A healer who founded St. Mungo’s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries. He was also Wizard of the Month of March, 2005 on J.K. Rowling’s official site.

name: Terry Boot
description: A Ravenclaw in Harry’s year who joined the D.A. He was one of the D.A. member who helped with the ambush of Malfoy on the Hogwarts express in Book 6.

name: Gladys Boothby
description: Invented the Moontrimmer Broomstick.

name: Libatius Borage
description: Author of Advanced Potion

name: Borgin
description: One of the owner’s of the shop Borgin and Burkes in Knockturn Alley that sells things of the Dark Arts.

name: Bertie Bott
description: Creator of the favorite wizard (and now also muggle) Bertie Bott’s Every Flavor Beans.

name: Bozo
description: A photographer who works for the daily prophet, taking pictures while Rita Skeeter writes the articles.

name: Bradley
description: A Ravenclaw chaser mentioned in Book 5.

name: Barberus Bragge
description: Chief of the Warlock’s Council in 1262 who offered over 150 Galleons to whoever caught the Golden Snidget first. A women from the audience went out to protest to the harm of the bird, and summoned it. From then on, the Snidget became a regular part of a quidditch game.

name: Rudolph Brand
description: Captain of the Heidelburg Harries who at the end of the match proposed to the captain of the other team

name: Maximus Brankovitch III
description: Seeker for the Fitchburg Finches in Massachusetts, United States.

name: Eleanor Branstone
description: A girl who was sorted into Hufflepuff in Book 4.

name: Kevin and Karl Broadmoor
description: Beaters for the Falmouth Falcons from 1958 to 1969.

name: Mandy Brocklehurst
description: A girl in Harry’s year who was sorted into Ravenclaw in Book 1.

name: Rupert “Axebanger” Brook Stanton
description: A name Hermione comes across when looking for somebody with initials R.A.B.

name: Lavender Brown
description: A Gryffindor girl in Harry’s year who is best friends with Pavarti Patil. She attends the Yule Ball with Seamus Finnigan, and likes the subject of divination. She joined the D.A. as soon as it was formed, Is Ron’s girlfriend in Book 6.

name: Frank Bryce
description: The Riddle’s gardener who the people of the village thought had killed the riddles. He is killed by Wormtail with the Avada Kedavra curse after overhearing what Voldemort and Wormtail had been talking about.

name: Buckbeak
description: The hippogriff that is taught in Care of Magical Creatures in Book 3. If hurts Malfoy after he insults him and is sentenced to death. Harry and Hermione save him, and then he and Sirius Black escape together. He lives in the Black house in Books 3 and 4, and eventually goes back to Hogwarts with Hagrid being disguised as a different hippogriff, Witherwings.

name: Millicent Bulstrode
description: An ugly Slytherin girl in Harry’s grade who has a cat (seeing that Hermione took cat hair off her robes for the polyjuice potion in Book 2, thinking they were Millicent’s.) Part of Umbridge’s Inquisitorial Squad in Book 5. She also checked out quidditch through the ages (due back February 6)

name: K. Bunky
description: Checked out Quidditch through the Ages (Due back on October 12th)

name: Rosalind Antigone Bungs
description:
A name Hermione comes across when looking for somebody with the initials R.A.B.
 Burbage, Professor Charity

name: Caractucus Burke
description: Owner of the Dark Art’s store Borgin and Burkes in Knockturn Alley.

name: Sir Cadogan
description: Guards the entrance to the Gryffindor common room when the fat lady’s portrait is destroyed, because none of the other portrait’s are brave enough to do it. Changes the passwords daily and challenges students to duels. He also lets Sirius Black into Gryffindor tower since he had the passwords (Neville wrote them on pieces of paper and then looses them).

name: Cadwallader
description: A Hufflepuff chaser in Book 6.

name: S. Capper
description: A student who checked out Quidditch through the Ages (Due back January 31st)

name: Eddie Carmichel
description: A Ravenclaw boy who received 9 owls the previous year (this year being Book 5) who tries to sell Harry and Ron Baruffio’s Brain Elixir which Hermione takes away because it is fake.

name: Alecto Carrow
description: A death eater that was part of the group led by Draco Malfoy who invaded Hogwarts. The sister of Amycus Carrow. When Voldemort took over Hogwarts, Alecto Carrow became the Muggle Studies teacher.

name: Amycus Carrow
description: A death eater with an odd laugh and was part of the death eaters led by Malfoy who invaded Hogwarts in Book 6. Alecto Carrow’s brother, a squat, “lumpy” looking wizard. When Voldemort took over the Hogwarts in the fall of 1997, Amycus was made the Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, although he simply taught students to perform the Dark Arts

name: Greta Catchlove
description: Author of Charm your Own Cheese.

name: Owens Cauldwell
description: A boy sorted into Hufflepuff in Book 4.

name: Chambers
description: A Ravenclaw seeker who tried to score on Ron, but Ron stopped it.

name: Glenda Chittock
description: Presenter on the Wizarding Wireless Network (WWN). Was also J.K. Rowling’s wizard of the month in October of 2004.

name: Agatha Chubb
description: Finder of wizarding artifacts including 12 bludgers from the 16th century.

name: Circe
description: A famous Greek with who was famous for transfiguring lost sailors into pigs

name: Elfrinda Clagg
description: Chief of the Warlock’s council who made the golden snidget a protected species and set up a reservation for them. JK Rowling’s wizard of the month in June, 2005. (Although in Quidditch through the Ages it says she was chief of the Wizard’s council). Her portrait is in St. Mungos’ (But that says Elfrinda Cragg, perhaps a mispelling)

name: Penelope Clearwater
description: Girlfriend of Percy Weasley since book 2, and head girl in book 3. She was petrified by the basilisk with Hermione Granger outside of the library.

name: Cliodna
description: Famous for having 3 birds who could heal with their songs, and she was an animagus that could change into a bird.

name: Edgar Clogg
description: A ghost that has been around the quidditch field for a long time (Character known from Quidditch World Cup game)

name: Cole
description: Head of the orphanage that Tom Riddle grew up in.

name: Connolly
description: Irish national team’s beater.

name: Ritchie Coote
description: A Gryffindor beater in Book 6.

name: Michael Corner
description: A Ravenclaw boy in Harry’s Year that Ginny dates and dumps because he was a sore loser from quidditch in Book 5. He later dated Cho Chang in Book 5 also.

name: Crabbe
description: A death eater who is the father of Vincent Crabbe and never went to Azkaban.

name: Vincent Crabbe
description: A Slytherin boy in Harry’s year who is one of Draco Malfoy’s best friends. Very dumb and fat like Goyle, Crabbe also plays beater in the Slytherin quidditch team in books 4 and 5, and hits Harry in the back after the game was over. Was killed in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.

name: Elfrinda Cragg
description: See Clagg, Elfrinda

name: Crapaud
description: A character in a play written by the French Wizard Malecrit called “las, Je me suis Transfigurles Pieds”

name: Colin Creevy
description: A Gryffindor boy 1 year young than Harry who was very keen on Harry in the books, especially the 2nd one (taking pictures of him every minute). He was petrified in Book 2 after seeing the Basilisk through his camera. He and his brother Dennis are in the D.A. Both boys are also muggle born. Was killed during battle in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.

name: Dennis Creevy
description: Probably the youngest kid in the D.A. (a second year) Dennis Creevy is the younger brother of Colin Creevy. Also very keen of Harry and small for his age (or at least he was the smallest kid being sorted in Book 4). He has brown hair and likes to hang out with 2 years older brother Colin.

name: Dirk Cresswell
description: One of Slughorn’s old favorite students who is now head of the Goblin Liaison Office.

name: Croaker
description: Works for the Department of Mysteries in the Ministry of Magic

name: Doris Crockford
description: A witch Harry met in the Leaky Cauldron in the beginning of Book 1.

name: Crispin Cronk
description: He was famous for keeping sphinxes in his backyard. He was eventually sent to Azkaban for not giving them up.

name: Crookshanks
description: Hermione’s ginger cat who is part kneazle.

name: Barty Sr. Crouch
description: Bartemius Crouch used to be one of the best auror’s around. He was headed to be the next minister of magic, before his son turned out to be a death eater. He sent his own son to Azkaban, before sneaking him out and putting his dying mother in his place (using polyjuice potion). He kept his son Barty Crouch Jr. under the imperius curse, but he eventually fought it and got away. He returned to Lord Voldemort and killed his father (to read more, go to Crouch, Barty Jr.)

name: Barty Jr. Crouch
description: Raised by Barty Crouch Sr. who was a ministry auror and his mother, he became a death eater and was sent to Azkaban by his father. His father snuck him out on his mothers wished by putting her (who was dying) in his place in Azkaban. She died there a little while after. He was put under the imperius curse until he fought it and managed to get a wand at the quidditch world cup, where he shot the dark mark into the air. Crouch Sr. realized it and put him under the curse once again. Voldemort then personally came to get Crouch Jr., putting Crouch Sr. on the curse. Barty Jr. then went to Hogwarts pretending to be Mad

name: Crouch
description: Wife of Barty Crouch Sr. and mother of Barty Crouch Jr. After her son was put in Azkaban, she begged her husband to switch them. She drank polyjuice potion with his hairs in it, and he drank it with her and they transformed. She later died in Azkaban.

name: Gideon Crumb
description: Plays the bagpipes in the band the Weird Sisters.

name: Barabas Cuffe
description: Editor of the Daily Prophet who used to be in the Slug Club at Hogwarts.

name: Gerta Curd
description: Author of Charm your own Cheese.

name: Damocles
description: The uncle of Marcus Belby who invented the Wolfsbane potion.

name: Roger Davies
description: A Ravenclaw boy who is captain of the quidditch team. He took Fleur Delacour to the Yule Ball in Book 4. He asked Cho Chang out in Book 5, but she turned him down.

name: Tracy cDavis
description: A girl sorted into Slytherin in Harry’s year (Mentioned in an interview with J.K. Rowling).

name: Dawlish
description: Described as a tough looking wizard with short hair. An auror who works for the Ministry of Magic. He came with Fudge to try and expell Harry, but was knocked out along with Umbridge, Kingsley, and Fudge by Dumbeldore. He also tried to arrest Hagrid in Book 5. Later, in Book 6 he was assigned to Hogsmeade in Book 6 to guard it along with Tonks, Proudfoot, and Savage. Scrimgeous sent Dawlish after Dumbledore in book 6 to follow him to wherever he was going.

name: Caradoc Dearborn
description: A wizard from the picture of the Order of the Phoenix in Book 5 who disappeared and was probably dead.

name: Apolline Delacour
description: Married to Monsieur Delacour and mother of Fleur and Gabrielle Delacour. Was present for the Third Task of the Triwizard Tournament held at Hogwarts. Madame Delacour is described as being a beautiful blonde woman and accomplished at household spells

name: Fleur Delacour
description: The Beabatons champion of the Triwizard Tournament in Book 4. She’s tall and part veela, and of course very pretty. After she graduated Beabatons, she got a job in Gringotts bank to improver her English. While there, she met her fiance Bill Weasley. (That’s how she is related to the Black’s because Arthur Weasley is Sirius’s second cousin once removed, so Bill is related to Sirius, and Fleur is getting married to Bill, so they are related by marriage). Has a daughter named Victoire.

name: Gabrielle Delacour
description: The younger sister of Gabriella Delacour. Harry saved her in the second task of the Triwizard Tournament in Book 4 because he did not think Fleur would be there in time to save her.

name: Monsieur Delacour
description: Married to Appoline Delacour and father of Fleur and Gabrielle Delacour. Attended the Third Task of the Triwizard Tournament . Monsieur Delacour is short, plump, and as having a little, pointed black beard

name: Delaney
description: Podmore, Patrick

name: Laverne de Montmorency
description: Invented many love potions.

name: Dennis
description: A boy in Dudley’s gang.

name: Derek
description: A Hogwarts first year who stayed over and was surprised that Dumbeldore knew him (after Dumbledore asked him to pass him something) in Book 3.

name: Derrick
description: A Slytherin boy mentioned in Books 3 and 5 who was a beater on the Slytherin quidditch team.

name: Dilys Derwent
description: A famous witch who was portraits in Hogwarts and other wizarding buildings who was a St. Mungo’s healer(1722 to 1741). She also used to be a headmistress at Hogwarts (from 1741 to 1768) and is the one who told Dumbledore Arthur Weasley was taken into St. Mungo’s in Book 5.

name: Philbert Deverill
description: Manager of the Puddlemere United Quidditch Team.

name: Diddy
description: A name that Aunt Petunia calls Dudley.

name: Dedalus Diggle
description: A member of the Order of the Phoenix who Harry met in the Leaky Cauldron in Book 1. He lives in Kent and lacks a bit of common sense.

name: Amos Diggory
description: The father of Cedric Diggory (who dies in book 4). Works for the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures. Very emotional and lives near the Weasleys.

name: Cedric Diggory
description: The Hogwarts Champion (besides Harry) who tied winning the Triwizard Tournament with Harry Potter. Unfortunately, the cup was a portkey and transported him to a graveyard with Harry> He was killed by Wormtail (Voldemort’s servant). He was also the Hufflepuff seeker and captain and dated Cho Chang before he died.

name: Diggory
description: The mother of Cedric Diggory and the wife of Amos Diggory. Is not as emotional as her husband.

name: Dimitrox
description: A Bulgarian chaser on the Bulgarian National Quidditch Team.

name: Harold Dingle
description: Tried to sell Dragon Claws as a study aid, which actually turned out to be pixie droppings in Book 5.

name: Dinky Diddydums
description: A name that Aunt Petunia calls Dudley

name: Armando Dippet
description: Headmaster of Hogwarts when Tom Marvolo Riddle (Lord Voldemort) attended.

name: Emma Dobbs
description: Was sorted in Book 4 into Hufflepuff.

name: Daisy Dodderidge
description: Creator of the Leaky Cauldron. Was made to connect the wizarding and muggle worlds.

name: Dobby
description: A very kind house elf that was first introduced in Book 2. He came to warn Harry not to go back to Hogwarts (and blocked Harry and Ron from going to Hogwarts, and bewitching the bludger to hit Harry’s arm so he would go back to the Dursley’s and leave Hogwarts). Dobby also appeared at the end of this book, where Harry set him free by giving his owner, Lucius Malfoy a sock and throwing it in the air. Dobby caught it and was set free. Dobby then came to work at Hogwarts with his friend Winky. Here, he helped Harry several times such as giving him the Gillyweed so he can breathe under water in the second task in Book 4. Dobby told Harry about the Room of Requirement so he could have the D.A. meetings there, and Dobby and Kreacher (another House Elf) followed Malfoy to find out what he’s doing in Book 6. Was killed by Bellatrix Lestrange in Deathly Hallows after saving Harry and company.

name: Elphias Doge
description: An old wizard who was in the order before and after the fall of Voldemort, as well as in the present books. Was one of the Advanced Guard who came to get Harry from the Dursley’s in Book 5. Wrote Dumbledore’s obituary in Deathly Hallows.

name: Antonin Dolohov
description: Death eater who was sent to Azkaban for murdering the Prewett brothers (brothers of Molly Weasley) and betrayed by Karkaroff. He was amoung those who escaped from Azkaban in Book 5. He was recaptured after fighting for Voldemort in the Department of Mysteries.

name: Ragmar Dorkins
description: Manger of the Chudley Cannons

name: J. Dorny
description: Checked out Quidditch Through the Ages (Due back on December 5th)

name: Dudders
description: A name that Aunt Petunia calls Dudley.

name: Kirley Duke
description: Lead guitar player in the wizarding band the wierd sisters.

name: Alberforth Dumbeldore
description: Dumbledore’s brother is described as a strange bloke by Moody. He is the bartender of the Hog’s Head.

name: Albus Dumbledore
description: (Full name: Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore) Old Hogwarts Headmaster before McGonagall. Was known to be the only wizard that Voldemort ever feared. The head of the Order of the Phoenix and it’s secret keeper. He was murdered by Severus Snape at the end of Book 6. He was most famous for the defeat of the dark wizard Grindelwald in 1945, for the discovery of the 12 uses of dragon’s blood, and for his work in alchemy with Nicholas Flamel.

name: Ariana Dumbledore
description: Dumbledore’s younger sister who was tormented by 3 muggle boys and this resulted in her never using magic until it had built up so much that it would explode out of her. She was killed when Albus and Gellert Grindelwald were fighting.

name: Kendra Dumbledore
description: Mother of Albus, Aberforth and Ariana Dumbledore. She was accidently killed by Ariana.

name: Dumbledore Percival
description: Father of Albus, Aberforth and Ariana Dumbledore. Was sent to Azkaban after attacking the muggle boys who hurt his daughter.

name: B Dunstan
description: Checked out Quidditch Through the Ages (due back on May 16th)

name: Dudley Dursley
description: Harry Potter’s mean and very fat cousin who is the only child of Vernon and Petunia Dursley. He was always mean to Harry but grew fearful of him when he learned magic.

name: Marjorie (Marge) Dursley
description: Marjorie Dursley is the sister of Vernon Dursley. Although she is not related to Harry Potter, he was forced to call her Aunt Marge. She insults Harry’s parents and accidentally blows her up like a balloon.

name: Petunia Dursley
description: The sister of Harry’s mother who is described as a horse

name: Vernon Dursley
description: Harry’s uncle (by marriage to Petunia Evans) who is a big beefy man and does not like Harry. He does not like magic and tried to squish it out of Harry by never telling him the truth about him being a wizard and having wizarding parents (of which were killed by the Dark Lord Voldemort).

name: Dzou Yen
description: A Chinese Alchemist.

name: Eargit the Awful
description: The goblin representative at the 14th century wizards council.

name: Marietta Edgecombe
description: The friend of Cho Chang’s who joined the D.A. and then sold them out to Professor Umbridge. The words sneak appeared all over her face because there was a jinx on the paper and whoever told would have sneak written all of their face. Her mother works in the ministry of magic department of Magical Transportation, Floo Network Office. She could not however tell because Order of the Phoenix member Kingsley Shacklebolt quickly modified her memory. She then told Fudge she did not know of the D.A.

name: Madam Edgecombe
description: Mother of Marietta Edgecombe (see above) and works for the Ministry of Magic in the Department of Magical Transportation, Floo Network Office. She helped Fudge watch the Hogwarts fires.

name: Egbert the Egregious
description: He possessed the Elder Wand for some time and slaughtered Emeric the Evil to gain it.

name: Mordicus Egg
description: Author of “The Philosophy of the Mundane: Why Muggles Prefer Not to Know.”

name: Elladora
description: Started the tradition of beheading a house elf when it is too old to hold a tea tray in the Black family. (Also see under Black

name: Ellerby
description: Brought out a new model of the Tinderblast and the Swiftstick.

name: Wilfred Elphick
description: First person to be gored by an Erumpent.

name: Emeric the Evil
description: Wizard who Binns sometimes mixes up with Uric the Oddball in class. He possessed the Elder Wand for some time and was slaughtered by Emeric the Evil to gain it.

name: Ethelred the Ever
description: Ready

name: Errol
description: The Weasley family’s old owl.

name: Petunia Evans
description: See Dursley, Petunia

name: Mark Evans
description: A muggle boy who Dudley and gang tormented. No relation to Lily Evans.

name: Everard
description: Former headmaster of Hogwarts who has a portrait in Hogwarts, the Ministry of Magic, and several other Wizarding locations.

name: Perpetua Fancourt
description: Invented the Lunascope

name: Fang
description: Hagrid’s black boarhound. Is quite a coward, even though looks very strong.

name: Fat Friar
description: The Hufflepuff house ghost.

name: Fat Lady
description: The portrait of the Fat Lady covers the entrance to the Gryffindor tower (and has for a long time, probably at least 40 or so years).

name: Fawcetts
description: A family of wizards that live near the Weasleys and the Diggorys. 1 known member of their family goes to Hogwarts (see below).

name: S. Fawcett
description: A Ravenclaw girl in Harry’s year (though not confirmed). She, like Fred and George, tried to use an age potion to get across Dumbledore’s line to enter the Triwizard Tournament in Book 4. During the 2nd book, she and Ernie Macmillan were put together as partners for dueling club. She also gets in trouble after overhearing Karkaroff talk to Snape in Book 4.

name: Fawkes
description: A phoenix that belongs to Professor Dumbledore. It can carry very heavy loads, has a magical song, has the ability to heal, and it a very faithful pet. She gave two wand feathers; one for Voldemort’s wand and one for Harry’s.

name: Benji Fenwick
description: A member of the old Order of the Phoenix who was killed by death eaters.

name: Fergus
description: Seamus Finnigan’s cousin who apparates just to annoy Seamus.

name: Arabella Doreen Figg
description: A muggle who lives on Wisteria Walk near the Dursleys. She owns many cats and is a squib, meaning that she was born into a magical family but does is not magical. She was instructed by Dumbledore (when Harry was young) to keep an eye on Harry. She was Harry’s babysitter who was mean to him (because if she was nice, the Dursley’s wouldn’t want Harry going over there). She was discovered by the reader to be associated with the wizarding world in Book 5.

name: Argus Filtch
description: The caretaker at Hogwarts who despises of students and is a squib. His best friend is Mrs. Norris and (though slightly mentioned in Book 6) appears to have a relationship with Madam Pince, the librarian.

name: Finch
description: Fletchley, Justin

name: Fingal the Fearless
description: An Irish wizard who was said to be an Aingingein champion.

name: Finnigan
description: Seamus Finnigan’s mother who Harry, Ron, and Hermione met at the Quidditch World Cup in book 4. She also believed that Harry was making everything up about Voldemort coming back like many other wizards in the wizarding world.

name: Firenze
description: A centaur who takes the place of Professor Trelawney when she is fired as Divination teacher. He also helped Harry in his first year.

name: Nicholas Flamel
description: Friend of Dumbledore famous for creating the Philosopher’s (Sorcerer’s) Stone. Died somewhere between Harry’s 1st year and his 5th year.

name: Perenelle Flamel
description: Wife of Nicholas Flamel

name: Angus Fleet
description: A muggle man who saw the Ford Anglia before it going invisible.

name: Mudungus Fletcher
description: Although he is a criminal in his own way. Mudungus Fletcher is a member of the Order of the Phoenix. His job (in Book 5) was to watch over Harry. He stepped out for a few minutes to buy stolen cauldrons, and that was when Harry was attacked by dementors. He is useful for the order because he knows all of the criminals.

name: Marcus Flint
description: A Slytherin student who is a chaser and captain of the Slytherin Quidditch Team in Books 1 through 3. According to J.K. Rowling, he had to do a year over.

name: Filius Flitwick
description: The charms teacher and head of Ravenclaw house at Hogwarts.

name: Florence
description: A Hogwarts student that Rita Skeeter supposedly saw kissing

name: Flourish
description: One of the owners of Flourish and Blotts (though not confirmed).

name: Flourish and Blotts (Manager)
description: A wizard who works in Flourish and Blotts who tries to keep Lockhart’s signing controlled, gets very scared when Harry walks into the shop looking for his books (thinking he wanted a copy of the monster book of monsters), lost a large quantity of invisible books that cost a fortune, and advises Harry not to buy Death Omens: What to Do When You Know the Worst Is Coming.

name: Fluffy
description: The three headed dog that was kept guarding the trap door that led to the sorcerer’s stone (although there were many more obstacles) in book 1. It can be put to sleep with music.

name: Ambrosius Flume
description: Owner of Honeydukes who left his shop abandoned in Book 6.

name: Florean Fortescue
description: Owner of the Ice Cream Parlor that game Harry free sundaes in Book 3. He was taken by Voldemort in the Summer between books 5 and 6.

name: Fridwulfa
description: Giantress and mother of Rubeus Hagrid and Grawp. Abandoned Hagrid and his father when Hagrid was young. Also abandoned Grawp because he was small.

name: Vicky Frobisher
description: A girl who tried out for keeper and flew better than Ron, but said if practice came in the way of her Charms Club, then she would not go to practice, therefore not getting a spot on the team.

name: Colonel Fubster
description: A man who looks after Aunt Marge’s 12 dogs when she is not home.

name: Cornelius Fudge
description: Minister of Magic from Books 1 through 5. Used to be very keen of Harry in Books 1 through 4, but in Book 5 he believed that Harry was making up that Voldemort was back in order to get detention. He was later proven wrong and sacked of the job and replaced by Rufus Scrimgeour.

name: Fulbert the Fearful
description: A very fearful wizard who never left his house, thinking he would get hurt. He died when his roof collapsed after a spell backfire.

name: Dymphna Furmage
description: A witch terrified of pixies.

name: Marvolo Gaunt
description: The grandfather of Lord Voldemort who (like Voldemort) is a parseltongue. His daughter, Merope (Voldemort’s mother) ran off and married a muggle. He does not think highly of muggle borns or muggles. Tom Riddle was named after him (his middle name

name: Merope Gaunt
description: The mother of Tom Riddle (Lord Voldemort) who fell in love with muggle Tom Riddle. She used a love potion to make him fall in love with her. She was pregnant when she stopped using the love potion on her, and then he left her. She died giving birth to Tom Riddle. (she is under Slytherin because she is related to him)

name: Morfin Gaunt
description: The crazy brother of Merope Gaunt and son of Marvolo Gaunt. He was put under the imperius curse by his nephew Tom Marvolo Riddle (Lord Voldemort) to say that he killed Tom Riddle (Voldemort’s father) and his parents, where it was actually Tom Marvolo (Voldemort) that did.

name: (Guant) Tom Marvolo
description: Tom Marvolo (Surname of Riddle) was the daughter of Merope Guant. To see more, see Riddle, Tom Marvolo or Voldemort.

name: Ghoul (of the Weasleys)
description: The creature that is living in the attic of the Weasley house.

name: Giant Squid (of Hogwarts)
description: A friendly giant squid that lives in the Hogwarts lake. It swims with students after owls in Book 5, and saved Dennis Creevy after he fell in the lake by putting him back into the boat (on his way to Hogwarts

name: Anthony Goldstein
description: A prefect Ravenclaw boy in Harry’s grade who is a member of the D.A.

name: Golgomath
description: The giant that killed the Giant Karkus and took Karkus’s position as the Gurg. He prefers the death eaters to Hagrid and Madam Maxine.

name: Golpalott
description: A man who set down the law saying that the antidote for a blended poison will be equal to or more than the sum of the antidotes for each of the separate components.

name: Gordon
description: A boy in Dudley’s gang.

name: Miranda Goshawk
description: Author of the Standard Book of Spells series.

name: Goyle
description: Father of Hogwarts student Gregory Goyle (below) and an active death eater.

name: Gregory Goyle
description: A boy in Slytherin in Harry’s grade who is friends with Draco Malfoy. His father is a death eater along with Malfoy’s father and Crabbe’s (See Crabbe, Vincent) father. He is a beater on the Slytherin quidditch team in books 5 and 6. He has short hand and gorilla

name: Merton Graves
description: Plays cello for the wizarding band the Weird Sisters.

name: Grawp
description:
Hagrid’s 1/2 brother from his mother’s side who is 16 feet tall. Hagrid hides him in the forbidden forest after bringing him back from his journey with the giants. Hagrid asked Harry, Ron, and Hermione to teach his English. Calls Hagrid “Hagger” and Hermione “Hermy”.

 Greengrass, Daphne

name: Gregorovitch
description: Bulgarian wand maker who made Viktor Krum’s wand. Was later killed by Voldemort when he was looking for the Elder Wand.

name: Gregory the Smarmy
description: A medieval wizard who created Gregory’s Unctuous Unction; a potion that made the drinker think the person who gave it to them was their best friend. There is also a statue of him in Hogwarts with a secret passage behind it.

name: Grenouille
description: A character who was a keeper in a play by the French playwright Malecrit who wrote “las, Je me suis Transfigurles Pieds”

name: Grey Lady (Helena Ravenclaw)
description: The Ravenclaw house ghost. The daughter of Rowena Ravenclaw, she stole her mothers diadem to become more clever and smarter than her mother. Then she was murdered by the Bloody Baron who loved her.

name: Fenrir Greyback
description: A friend of the Malfoy family who Draco threatened Borgin with in Knockturn Alley. He is a very dangerous werewolf who sets himself near lots of muggles and wizards when he turns into a werewolf; hoping to bite more people. He was actually the wizard who bit Remus Lupin (See Lupin, Remus). He comes to Hogwarts to attack at the end of Book 6 and bites Bill Weasley while in his human state. Bill’s face gets torn a cut very badly, but we are not sure if he will be a werewolf or not; seeing Greyback was still in his human form.

name: Glynnis Griffiths
description: Seeker for the Holyhead Harpies quidditch team.

name: Elias Grimstone
description: Broommaker who created the Oakshaft 79

name: Gelert Grindelwald
description: The wizard that Dumbledore defeated in the 1945. Was best friends with Dumbledore back in the day before they had a falling out where Dumbledore’s sister Arianna was killed. He was defeated by Albus and spend the rest of his days in Nurmengard prison. He was murdered by Voldemort in his quest to find the Elder Wand.

name: Gringott
description: The goblin founder of Gringott’s Wizarding bank.

name: Griphook
description: A goblin who works at Gringott’s Bank.

name: Grubbly
description: Plank, Professor

name: Alberic Grunnion
description: The inventor of the dungbomb.

name: Godric Gryffindor
description: Found of the house of Gryffindor. He prized courage among the student. He was also the one who thought of the idea of the sorting hat.

name: Malodora Grymm
description: A hag who used a beauty potion to make her look beautiful. She married the king of the land, and poisoned the prettiest girl in the area because she was jealous of her.

name: Platform Guard
description: The man who guards platform 9 3/4 and collects the ticket to the train.

name: Davey Gudgeon
description: A boy who almost lost an eye by playing a game of trying to touch the trunk of the Whomping Willow.

name: Galvin Gudgeon
description: The seeker for the Chudley Cannons who is a bit bim

name: Gladys Gudgeon
description: One of Lockhart’s biggest fans who writes to him weekly.

name: Gunhilda of Gorsemoor
description: An ugly with who was a great healer; developing a cure for Dragon Pox. She also has a statue of herself in Hogwarts which is also a secret passage. If you say the password, her hump on her back opens up to a tunnel, leading to Honeydukes cellar.

name: Gunhilda
description: A witch mentioned in a letter from Goodwin to his cousin Olaf in Quidditch through the Ages. It says that she had dragon pox, and was not up to playing quidditch, so they had to use Radulf the blacksmith instead (probably not the gunhilda mentioned above)

name: Gwenog
description: A witch who was not very liked because she played quidditch.

name: Rubeus Hagrid
description: He was the wizard (1/2 giant) who delivered Harry to the Dursleys when he was a baby. He then came back 10 years later (when Harry was 11) and told Harry he was a wizard, brining him to Hogwarts. He was keeper of game and keys at Hogwarts until Book 3, where he had these jobs plus a new one; Care of Magical Creatures teacher. He is an active member of the Order of the Phoenix; where he went on a large mission in Book 5; where he had to convince giants not to go on the side of Voldemort. He also brought back his 1/2 brother Grawp with him. Is also a friend of Harry, Ron, and Hermione. He was expelled from Hogwarts when he was in his 3rd year, after supposedly raising the monster in the chamber of secrets (which was later proven incorrect)

name: Hagrid
description: Father of Rubeus Hagrid who died when Hagrid was in his 2nd year of Hogwarts. Was married (or assumed) to the giant Fridwulfa (look under F section). Raised Hagrid on his own after Fridwulfa left.

name: Ciceron Harkiss
description: Gave Ambrosius Flume of Honeydukes his first job.

name: Harper
description: A Slytherin boy in Ginny’s year who filled in for Malfoy in a Quidditch game in Book 6.

name: Warty Harris
description: A wizard whose toads were stolen by Mudungus Fletcher.

name: Hedwig the owl
description: Harry’s pet snow owl who was attacked in Book 5 and killed in book 7.

name: Hengist of Woodcroft
description: Moved to Scotland and started the wizarding village of Hosmeade.

name: Hengist of Upper Barnton
description: Giant killed by a giant

name: Hermes
description: Percy’s owl which was a gift for becoming a prefect.

name: Hermy
description: The name given to Hermione Granger (see Granger, Hermione) by Grawp (see Grawp above)

name: Herpo the Foul
description: The creator of the basilisk and a parseltongue.

name: Bertie Higgs
description: A man who went hunting with McLaggen, his uncle Tiberius, and Rufus Scrimgeour.

name: Terrence Higgs
description: The seeker for Slytherin in Book 1, who graduated and then was replaced by Malfoy.

name: Glover Hipworth
description: Invented the peppermint potion, which cures a common cold.

name: Hokey
description: A house elf that was owned by Hepzibah Smith.

name: Rolanda Hooch
description: She teaches flying class to first years and is pretty much in charge of all things to do with quidditch. She keeps the ball box in her office, and is the referee in quidditch matches.

name: Geoffrey Hooper
description: Tried out for keeper in Book 5 and flew better than Ron Weasley, but was a whiner therefore not making the team.

name: Malfalda Hopkirk
description: Employee of the Improper Use of Magic Office at the Ministry of Magic who sends letters to underage wizards who used magic.

name: Hoppy
description: One of Newt Scamander’s pet kneazles.

name: Olive Hornby
description: Witch who teased Myrtle (Moaning Myrtle) and found her dead. She was then stocked by Myrtle’s ghost.

name: Hornby
description: Brother of Olive Hornby who had his wedding haunted by Moaning Myrtle.

name: Basil Horton
description: Played for the Falmouth Falcons who started the Comet trading company (along with Randolph Keitch).

name: Old Mother Hubbard
description: A hag who lured animals into her house and starved them to death.

name: Helga Hufflepuff
description: Founder of the house of Hufflepuff and one of the founders of Hogwarts who favored loyal students.

name: Humongous Bighead
description: The name that Fred and George Weasley changed Percy Weasley’s head boy badge to say.

name: Ickle Diddykins
description: A name that Aunt Petunia calls her son Dudley (see Dursley).

name: Inigo Imago
description: Author of the Dream Oracle.

name: Ingolfr the Iambic
description: A poet from the 1400’s who wrote some about Quidditch.

name: Ivanova
description: Chaser on the Bulgarian Quidditch Team.

name: Joey Jenkins
description: Beater for the Chudley Cannons.

name: Leonard Jewkes
description: Created the Silver Arrow Racing Broom.

name: Arsenius Jigger
description: Author of Magical Drafs and Potions, which is a book required for 1st year students for potions.

name: Angelina Johnson
description: A Gryffindor house chaser from books 1 through 5. She was also quidditch captain in book 5. She is a tall black girl who went to the Yule Ball with Fred Weasley.

name: Gwenog Jones
description: Captain and beater of the Holyhead Harpies.

name: Hestia Jones
description: A member of the advanced guard of the Order of the Phoenix who came to get Harry from the Dursley’s in Book 5.

name: Lee Jordan
description: A boy with dreadlocks 2 years older than Harry and best friends with Fred and George Weasley. After Fred and George left in Book 5, he levitated nifflers into Umbridge’s office to destroy it. He was also the commentator at the quidditch matches in Books 1 through 5.

name: Bertha Jorkins
description: A witch who worked for the Ministry of Magic. She disappeared after traveling to Albania to meet a cousin. She had a history of not a great memory (though in school she had a great one) and people thought she had just lost track of time while she was missing. It turned out that she was tortured for information by Lord Voldemort and killed. She also had a memory charm put on her Barty Crouch Sr. (See Crouch, Barty Sr.) after she overheard him talking to his son.

name: Jugson
description: Death eater who fought in the Department of Mysteries in Book 5.

name: Igor Karkaroff
description: Former head of Durmstrang who used to be a death eater. He did not go to Azkaban because he gave names of other death eaters. He fled at the end of Book 4, and it was hinted in book 6 that he was killed by death eaters.

name: Karkus
description: Name of the Gurg of the giants when Hagrid and Madam Maxine first arrive in the mountains in Book 5. He was killed by another giant (as giants usually do). He favored Hagrid and Madam Maxine more than the new Gurg did.

name: Gertie Keddle
description: A witch who write about quidditch in a diary, from the times that the quaffle was made out of leather.

name: Roland 1 Kegg
description: President of the English Gobstones Quidditch team.

name: Randolph Keitch
description: Played for the Falmouth Falcons and started the Comet Trading Company (along with Basil Horton).

name: Professor Kettleburn
description: Care of Magical Creatures teacher before Hagrid, retired after Book 2.

name: Elladora Ketteridge
description: The witch who discovered the use of gillyweed.

name: Kevin
description: A little boy at the quidditch world cup who took his father’s wand and enlarged a slug. His mother then took the wand away.

name: Kevin’s mother
description: Took the wand away from Kevin and accidentally stepped on an enlarged slug

name: R.J.H. King
description: A name that appeared on a plaque for Gryffindor Quidditch in the film Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone. This character does not appear in the book.

name: Andrew Kirke
description: Replaces one of the Weasley twins in Book 5 as beater on the Gryffindor Quidditch Team after the twins receive a life long ban.

name: Goodwin Kneen
description: Wrote to his cousin about the game of Kwiddich (now spelled Quidditch.)

name: Gunhilda Kneen
description: Wife of Goodwin Kneen (above) who played catcher (now known as chaser) for the Ilkley team. Could not play 1 match, and when her husband came back celebrating their win of that match, fired of many jinxes.

name: Montague 1 Knightley
description: Wizard Chess Champion.

name: Kreacher
description: The treacherous house elf that belonged to the Black family. He was very fond of Mr. and Mrs. Black (Sirius’s parents), most especially Mrs. Black. He used to live in a cabinet in the kitchen. He was the one who betrayed his master Sirius Black and told Harry that he was not home (Harry then assumed he was taken to the Department of Mysteries by Voldemort). Once Sirius died and left Harry all of his possessions, Kreacher became Harry’s servant. Harry sent him to live at Hogwarts and work in the kitchens. He was also assigned a job by Harry to follow Malfoy around in Book 4.

name: Krum
description: Father of Victor Krum. Described in Book 4 as having a hooked nose, such as his son does. He came to visit his son in the 3rd task of the Triwizard tournament in Book 4. Live in Bulgaria.

name: Krum
description: Mother of Victor Krum. Described in Book 4 as having dark hair. She came to visit her son in the 3rd task of the Triwizard tournament in Book 4. Live in Bulgaria.

name: Victor Krum
description: Bulgarian Seeker on their national quidditch team. Was also the champion for Durmstrang (his school) in the Triwizard Tournament in Book 4. He went to the Yule Ball with Hermione Granger (see Granger, Hermione) in Book 4, and was written a novel by her in Book 5. He invited her to come and stay with him in the summer between her 4th and 5th year, but she declined (we think) because she was with Ron Weasley in Grimmauld place (the headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix) in the beginning of book 5 (summer between year 4 and 5). Hermione was also the 1 thing that he would miss the most; because she was at the bottom of the lake for Krum to save in the Second Task of the Triwizard Tournament.

name: Lachlan the Lanky
description: A statue of this wizard is on the 7th floor at Hogwarts.

name: Landlady of the Green Dragon
description: Faked her own death (was supposedly killed by a lethifold).

name: Leanne
description: Hogwarts student with harry. She was a friend of Katie Bell’s and was with Katie when she touched the cursed opal necklace while visiting Hogsmeade.

name: Morgan 1 le Fey
description: Queen of the island of Avalon and a great healer during Queen Arthur’s time.

name: Amarillo 1 Lestoat
description: Author of A Vampire’s Monologu; which is intended to make the readers bored so they are better prey.

name: Bellatrix Lestrange
description: Is believed to be Voldemort’s number 1 death eater. Married Rudolph Lestrange and is the sister of Narcissa Malfoy and Andromeda Tonks. Has no children and was in Azkaban. She escaped in Book 5 with a lot of other death eaters. And she was also fighting in the department of ministries, where she killed her cousin Sirius Black.

name: Rabastan Lestrange
description: Brother of Rodolphus Lestrange and a death eater.

name: Rodolphus Lestrange
description: Husband of Belatrix Lestrange and a death eater.

name: Levski
description: Chaser on the Bulgarian National Quidditch Team.

name: Su Li
description: A Ravenclaw girl in Harry’s year.

name: Dai Llewellyn
description: Quidditch player for the Caerphilly Catapults who was eaten by a chimaera. Had a ward for bites named after him in St. Mungo’s.

name: Guthrie Lochrin
description: A wizard who complained about splinters in his bottom from a broomstick.

name: Gilderoy Lockhart
description: The Defense Against the Dark Arts Teacher in Book 2. Was famous for doing many famous things, none of which he really did. He heard the story in detail from the witch or wizard who really did it, and then gave them a memory charm and took credit for their story. He looses his memory by trying to perform a memory charm on Harry and Ron, but Ron’s broken wand backfires and he loses his memory. He now lives in St. Mungo’s and does not know who he is.

name: Algie Longbottom ()
description: Neville’s great uncle who played several tricks on Neville to make him show magical ability. He also bought Neville Trevor the Toad. He also got Neville his mimbulus mimbletonia from Assyria.

name: Alice Longbottom
description: Wife of Frank Longbottom and mother of Neville Longbottom. Used to be an auror until she and her husband were tortured by Death Eaters until the went insane. Round faced like her son, and now lives in St. Mungo’s. She and her husband escaped Voldemort Three Times.

name: Augusta Longbottom
description: Mother of Frank Longbottom and grandmother of Neville. She raised Neville after her son and his wife went insane due to torture by death eaters. She takes Neville to see his parents during holidays, and is always telling Neville to live up to the family name and be proud of his parents because before they were insane, they were great aurors.

name: Ernid Longbottom ()
description: Great Aunt of Nevile Longbottom who came in when Neville’s great Uncle Algie was holding Neville out of a window. She came in and Uncle Algie dropped Neville.

name: Frank Longbottom
description: A great auror and father of Neville Longbottom. He and his wife Alice were tortured by Death Eaters until they went insane. He now lives in St. Mungo’s. Him and his wife escaped from Voldemort three times.

name: and he was born at the end of July (1 day before Harry and was one of the last ones standing. He also fought when the death eaters came to Hogwarts in Book 6. This braveness is probably how he got into Gryffindor. He did not show any magical powers until he was 8. He could also have been the boy that the prophecy (about Harry) was written about. His parents defied Voldemort 3 times probably being one of the most improved students. He went to fight in Book 5 in the Department of Mysteries therefore sharing a dormitory with him. He is fairly bad at school with the exception of herbology. He was in the D.A. therefore he was raised by his grandmother; Augusta Longbottom. He is a round faced boy who is a bit of a klutz. He was born on July 30th and is in the same year and house as Harry Neville– Neville Longbottom is the son of Alice and Frank Longbottom. His parents were tortured and went insane Longbottom
description: July 30) Becomes the Herbology Professor of Hogwarts and marries Hannah Abbott.

name: Lovegood
description: Mother of Luna Lovegood who was a great witch and liked to experiment. She died when one of her experiments (a spell) went wrong, and Luna saw it.

name: Xenophilius Lovegood
description: Father of Luna Lovegood who is the editor of the Quibbler. He published Rita Skeeter’s article about Harry in the Quibbler, which sold extra well that issue that the reprinted it. His newspaper talks about unusual things that some people do no think is true (Hermione for example). A believer in the Deathly Hallows.

name: Loopy Lupin Loony
description: A nickname that Peeves the Poltergeist gives to Professor Lupin in Book 3.

name: Artemisia Lufkin
description: First witch to become Minister of Magic. Wizard of the Month on JKRowling.com on February, 2005.

name: Nymphadora (Dora) Tonks Lupin
description: See Nymphadora Tonks

name: Remus J. Lupin
description: The Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher in Book 3. He was also best friends with Sirius Black, James Potter, and Peter Pettigrew when he attended Hogwarts. He is a werewolf and was bitten when he was young. He is a member of the Order of the Phoenix and was a Gryffindor when he was younger. He was also made a prefect so that he could try and get his friends to behave. He has a girlfriend (or we all hope he will come to his senses and accept) who is Nymphadora Tonks. Was murdered in Deathly Hallows by Dolohov in the final battle.

name: Ted “Teddy” Remus Lupid
description: Orphan son of Remus and Tonks Lupin. He was raised by his grandmother and had regular meals with his godfather Harry. He is a metamorphmagus like his mother and is dating Victoire Weasley.

name: Aidan Lynch
description: Seeker for the Irish National Quidditch Team.

name: Magnus Macdonald
description: Headed a campaign to get rid of the game of Creaothceann, but failed.

name: Morag MacDougal
description: A student in Harry’s year (house unknown)

name: Hamish MacFarlan
description: Captain of the Montrose Magpies and former head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports.

name: MacFusty
description: Clan of wizards who take care of the Hebridean Black dragons on the Hebrides Islands.

name: Ernie Macmillan
description: A Hufflepuff boy who is in Harry’s year. He is a prefect in Book 5, and is also a member of the D.A.

name: Walden Macnair
description: A death eater who works for the Ministry of Magic as an executioner. He was also sent by Lord Voldemort to get the giants on their side in Book 5. He was sent to Azkaban at the end of Book 5 along with many other death eaters for fighting for Voldemort in the department of mysteries.

name: Alasdair Maddock
description: Chaser for the Montrose Magpies who tried to tie quidditch in with muggle sports such as soccer (football) and basketball.

name: Laura Madley
description: A girl sorted into Hufflepuff in Book 4.

name: Queen Maeve
description: A witch from Ireland who trained witches and wizards before Hogwarts.

name: Magorian
description: A centaur who lives in the Forbidden Forest and warns Hagrid to stay out of it.

name: Malcolm
description: A boy in Dudley’s gang.

name: Abraxas Malfoy
description: Draco Malfoy’s grandfather who died of Dragon Pox and knew Slughorn.

name: Draco– The son of Lucius and Narcissa Malfoy who comes from a pureblood family Malfoy
description: the Blacks and the Malfoys. He does not think highly of anybody who is not pureblood. He is Harry’s rival in quidditch as well as everything else. He is the seeker on the Slytherin quidditch team in books 2 through 6, and made it on the team by buying the whole team Nimbus 2001 broomsticks. Is a prefect in Book 5, as well as on Umbridge’s Inquisitorial Squad. In Book 6, it is proven that he is a death eater and has a job to bring death eaters into Hogwarts. He does so, and tells Dumbledore he will kill him. A gang of death eaters come out of them, and Snape kills Dumbledore. He is nearly killed in Book 6 by Harry Potter, who performs a spell on him without knowing what it was. His mother is a cousin of Sirius Black. Draco is almost killed a few times in Deathly Hallows and is saved by Harry.

name: Lucius Malfoy
description: The father of Draco Malfoy who is a death eater. He has the same thoughts as Draco about muggle borns and muggles. He is very rich and arrogant. He fought in the Department of Mysteries for Voldemort in Book 5, where he was caught and sent to Azkaban.

name: Narcissa (Black) Malfoy
description: The mother of Draco Malfoy, and the wife of Lucius Malfoy. First cousin of Sirius Black, and sister of Andromeda Tonks and Bellatrix Lestrange. She asked Snape to help her son Draco in the second chapter of Book 6. Her sister, Bellatrix, then preformed an unbreakable vow on Snape to protect Draco. Her nickname is Cissy.

name: Scorpius Malfoy
description: Son of Draco Malfoy and unknown wife.

name: Malecrit
description: Playwright who wrote “Hélas, Je me suis Transfiguré les Pieds”

name: Malkin
description: Known as Madam Malkin, she owns the robes shop in Diagon Alley; Madam Malkin’s Robes for All Occasions.

name: Mangorian
description: A centaur who lives in the Forbidden Forest who is the leader of them. He, like the other centaurs, does not trust humans.

name: Griselda Marchbanks
description: Head of the Wizarding Examinations Authority and a member of the Wizengamot. She resigned from her job when Umbridge became high inquisitor of Hogwarts. She tested Dumbledore and Harry in their O.W.L.S., and is a friend of Neville’s grandmother.

name: Beaumont Marjoribanks
description: Found many rare and magical plants.

name: Marsh
description: Madam Marsh appears in both times that Harry has ever ridden the knight bus. She was there in Book 3 and got off at Abergavenny seeming sick, and in the second time on the night bus in Book 5 she was ill and vomited.

name: Mason
description: (Mr. & Mrs.) Guests of the Dursley’s in Book 2. Vernon Dursley hoped to make a deal of work with Mr. Mason. They left when a pudding fell on Harry, and when an owl came swooping in over Mrs. Mason’s head.

name: Olympe Maxime
description: Headmistress of Beaxbatons. She, like Hagrid, is half giant (though she denied it) and goes on the mission with Hagrid in Book 5 to get the giants on Dumbledore’s side. She is a talented with who can do great spells.

name: Mauler
description: One of Newt Scamander’s pet kneazles.

name: McClivert
description: A clan of wizards who lived on the Island of Drear and were all killed off by the MacBoons.

name: Dugald McClivert
description: Head of the McClivert clan (above).

name: Catriona McCormack
description: Former chaser and Captain of the quidditch team the Pride of Portree. Her two children are also famous; her son is in the band the Weird Sisters, and her daughter also a quidditch player.

name: Kirley McCormack
description: Son of Catriona McCormack (above), brother of Meghan McCormack (below) and lead guitarist in the wizarding band the Weird Sisters.

name: Meghan McCormack
description: Keeper for the quidditch team Pride of Portree. Sister of Kirley McCormack and daughter of Catriona McCormack (both above).

name: Natalie McDonald
description: A girl sorted into Gryffindor in Book 4. She was the only character in Harry Potter to be named after a real person. Natalie McDonald was a Canadian girl with a fatal disease. who was a big Harry Potter fan. Her mother wrote to J.K. Rowling, and she wrote back saying secrets of the future books. Unfortunately, the letter arrived shortly after Natalie had died. J.K. Rowling then put her name in the book as a tribune to her.

name: Minerva McGonagall
description: Head of Gryffindor house and deputy headmistress of Hogwarts. She also sends the letters to the students inviting them to attend Hogwarts. She is an animagus, turning into a cat. She, like the rest of Gryffindor, likes to win the house and quidditch cup, urging on the Gryffindor team. She is transfiguration teacher at Hogwarts, and becomes headmistress at the end of Book 6, after the death of Professor Dumbledore.

name: M. G. McGonagall
description: A name that appears on a quidditch plaque next to James Potter’s. This name only appears in the Harry Potter film, not in the book. Probably not Professor McGonagall, seeing that she is much older than James Potter was.

name: Marlene McKinnon
description: A member of the Order of the Phoenix who was killed by death eaters along with her family (She appears in the photo Moody showed Harry in Book 5).

name: Cormac McLaggen
description: A loud mouth Gryffindor boy who tried out for keeper and was rejected. He was later put on the quidditch team for a short while, while Ron (who was Gryffindor keeper) was in the hospital wing. He also attended a Slughorn party with Hermione Granger (who invited him to make Ron jealous). During the one match that he played keeper, he took one of the beater’s bats and his it towards a Hufflepuff chaser. He missed it and hit Harry in the head, cracking his skull and knocking him unconscious.

name: Tibirius McLaggen
description: Cormac McLaggen’s uncle with whom he went hunting for nogtails with (Must be important, because Slughorn knows him and so does Rufus Scrimgeour).

name: Dorcas Meadows
description: A member of the Order of the Phoenix who was killed by Voldemort personally.

name: Araminta Meliflua
description: A cousin of Sirius’s mother who tried to make a law about muggle hunting legal.

name: Merlin
description: Found on a wizard card and the most famous wizard of the medieval times (Probably the Dumbledore of his time)

name: Galatea Merrythought
description: A teacher who Tom Riddle asks Slughorn if she is retiring (while he was at school). She is, and Tom Riddle asked Dumbledore if he could apply for the job.

name: Merwyn the Malicious
description: Known for creating jinxes and curses.

name: Eloise Midget
description: A girl who had an acne problem and tried to curse them off, and as a result her nose fell off.

name: Milly
description: One of Newt Scamander’s pet kneazles.

name: Mimsy
description: Porpington, Sir Nicholas de

name: Cordelia Misericordia
description: Representatives for hags at the 14th century wizards council.

name: Moaning Myrtle
description: A ghost of a Hogwarts student who was killed by the Basilisk in a bathroom. She was very made fun of, and stalked the girl (Olive Hornby) who made her cry and go into the bathroom in the first place, until Olive complained to the Ministry of Magic, and was forced to live in her toilet. She helped Harry and Ron find out where the chamber of secrets was, and helped Harry in figuring out how to work the egg for the 2nd task in the Triwizard Tournament (along with helping him in the actual 2nd task, by telling him which way to go to get Ron).

name: Cuthbert Mockridge
description: Head of the Goblin Liaison Office in the Ministry of Magic.

name: Montague
description: Chaser and Captain for the Slytherin quidditch team in Book 5. Also a member of Umbridge’s Inquisitorial squad who Fred and George stuffed in a vanishing cabinet after trying to take points from them. He was found a few days later in a toilet.

name: Montgomery
description: Sisters who attend Hogwarts. Their brother was attacked by a werewolf after their mother refused to help death eaters. He died in St. Mungo’s at the age of 5.

name: Alastor Moody
description: Nicknamed Mad

name: Moon
description: A student in Harry’s year (House unknown).

name: Moony
description: Remus Lupin’s (see Lupin, Remus J.) nickname at school.

description: The golden snitch evaded capture for six months on him in 1884, and both teams gave up because of the poor skills of their seekers.

name: Mopsus
description: Defeated the Seer Calchas.

name: Moran
description: Chaser for the Irish National Quidditch Team.

name: Gwendolyn Morgan
description: Captain of the Holyhead Harpies when they lost to the Heidelberg Harriers. The captain of the other team them proposed to her. She then hit him with her broomstick.

name: Morgana
description: See Le Fe, Morgana

name: Morholt
description: Giant brother of the King of Ireland.

name: Mortlake
description: A man brought in for questioning to the ministry of magic for having odd ferrets made by experimental charms.

name: Mosag
description: Aragog’s wife.

name: Hassan Mostafa
description: The referee for the 422nd Quidditch World Cup. Also Chairwizard of the International Associate of Quidditch.

name: Mr. Paws
description: One of Mrs. Figg’s cats.

name: Mulciber
description: A death eater who specializes in the Imperius Curse. Was in Azkaban but escaped with other death eaters in Book 5. He fought for Voldemort in the department of mysteries at the end of Book 5.

name: Burdock Muldoon
description: Chief of Wizard’s Council 1448 to 1450. He declared that any creatures that walked on 2 legs was classified as a being, therefore excluding centaurs and mermaids.

name: Mullet
description: Chaser for the Irish National Quidditch Team.

name: Zacharias Mumps
description: Wrote a description of Quidditch in the 14th century that resembles Quidditch today. He describe d it as oval shaped, five hundred feet long, and one hundred and eighty feet wide with a small circle in the center. He also described the players.

name: Eric Munch
description: A security wizard at the Ministry of Magic checking wands and likes to read the daily prophet in Book 5. Also arrested Sturgis Podmore for trespassing in the ministry.

name: Muriel (Aunt)
description: Reffered to as “Our Great Auntie Muriel” and Fleur wears her goblin

name: Murcus
description: Head of the mermaids that live in the Hogwarts lake.

description: Seeker for the Montrose Magpies who asked for the snitch to be faster.
